Package org.nineml.coffeefilter.trees

Class DataTreeBuilder

java.lang.Object
org.xml.sax.helpers.DefaultHandler
org.nineml.coffeefilter.trees.AbstractTreeBuilder
org.nineml.coffeefilter.trees.DataTreeBuilder
All Implemented Interfaces:
ContentHandler, DTDHandler, EntityResolver, ErrorHandler
public class DataTreeBuilder extends AbstractTreeBuilder
Construct a DataTree.

This builder can be passed to InvisibleXmlDocument.getTree() to build DataTree.

  • Constructor Details

    • DataTreeBuilder

      public DataTreeBuilder(ParserOptions options)
      Create a default data tree builder.

      The default builder allows duplicate names.

      Parameters:
      options - The parser options.

    • DataTreeBuilder

      public DataTreeBuilder(ParserOptions options, boolean allowDuplicateNames)
      Create a data tree builder.

      If duplicate names are not allowed, the builder will raise an exception if any node has more than one child with a given name.

      Parameters:
      options - The parser options.
      allowDuplicateNames - if false, children with duplicated names are forbidden.

  • Method Details

    • getTree

      public DataTree getTree()
      Get the tree once constructed.

      This method will return the tree, if it has been contructed.

      Returns:
      the tree, or null if no tree has yet been (completely) constructed.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Reset the builder.

      The builder isn't thread safe, but you can reuse it. Call reset between uses.

    • startElement

      public void startElement(String uri, String localName, String qName, Attributes attributes) throws SAXException
      Add an element to the DataTree.

      This method will throw exceptions if the tree structure can't be supported by DataTree, for example if the tree contains mixed content. Attributes are represented as child nodes.

      Specified by:
      startElement in interface ContentHandler
      Overrides:
      startElement in class DefaultHandler
      Parameters:
      uri - the element namespace URI, ignored.
      localName - the element local name, ignored.
      qName - The element QName, used as the name of the node.
      attributes - The element attributes.
      Throws:
      SAXException - If a SAX error occurs.
      IxmlTreeException - if the tree cannot be represented.

    • endElement

      public void endElement(String uri, String localName, String qName) throws SAXException
      Ends an element.
      Specified by:
      endElement in interface ContentHandler
      Overrides:
      endElement in class DefaultHandler
      Parameters:
      uri - the element namespace URI, ignored.
      localName - the element local name, ignored.
      qName - The element QName, used as the name of the node.
      Throws:
      SAXException - If a SAX error occurs.

    • characters

      public void characters(char[] ch, int start, int length) throws SAXException
      Add characters to the value of a {#link DataText} node.
      Specified by:
      characters in interface ContentHandler
      Overrides:
      characters in class DefaultHandler
      Parameters:
      ch - The array of characters.
      start - The first.
      length - The length.
      Throws:
      SAXException - If a SAX error occurs, which it never does.
